Description: Rim and body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery phiale; on top of rim, frieze of dots; inside, two broad bands with traces of added red on the upper; below, black-figure decoration consisting of foreleg of feline, to right; incised spoked rosette, dot and other incised motifs as filling ornament; exterior: single black (partly fired red) band just below rim.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.106) (Phase 1)
